required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of ShuntCheck Performance Characteristics in Asymptomatic Patients With Pseudotumor Cerebri

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine if the ShuntCheck test can correctly identify flow or no flow in a ventriculoperitoneal shunt in patients with pseudotumor cerebri.

primary_outcome.measure: Negative Predictive Value of ShuntCheck test

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of performing ShuntCheck test twice
Negative Predictive Value of performing ShuntCheck test twice

arm_group.description: Participants will be administered the ShuntCheck diagnostic test.

intervention.description: The intervention is an FDA-cleared device utilizing a transcutaneous thermal convection to analyze shunt flow.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will consist of asymptomatic PTC research subjects who have a VP shunt with a single ventricular catheter implanted for PTC and are visiting for routine care.

facility.name: University of South Florida Department of Neurological Surgery and Brain Repair

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, College of Medicine Neurosurgery

patient_data.ipd_description: At present there is no plan to share any individual participant data.
